body_html:
You can easily shuffle and batch using tf.train.shuffle_batch *so long as you don't have variable-length input tensors*.
…
On Wed, Apr 26, 2017 at 8:16 AM, Giulio Petrucci ***@***.***> wrote: I have spent the last week and maybe more dealing with such issue <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43367697/batching-and-shuffling-padded-tf-train-sequenceexample>. So, help me to uderstand (and save a lot of time): can we state that currently there is *no way* of shuffling and batching using the official TF input pipeline utilities? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. You can easily shuffle and batch using tf.train.shuffle_batch *so long as
you don't have variable-length input tensors*.

 So, help me to uderstand (and save a lot of time): can we state that

 TF input pipeline utilities?

body:
You can easily shuffle and batch using tf.train.shuffle_batch *so long as
you don't have variable-length input tensors*.

On Wed, Apr 26, 2017 at 8:16 AM, Giulio Petrucci <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I have spent the last week and maybe more dealing with such issue
> <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43367697/batching-and-shuffling-padded-tf-train-sequenceexample>.
> So, help me to uderstand (and save a lot of time): can we state that
> currently there is *no way* of shuffling and batching using the official
> TF input pipeline utilities?
>
> —
